de.sub.goobi.metadaten.copier

Class MetadataPathSelector

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.sub.goobi.metadaten.copier.DataSelector
      • de.sub.goobi.metadaten.copier.MetadataSelector
        • de.sub.goobi.metadaten.copier.MetadataPathSelector

  • public class MetadataPathSelector
extends MetadataSelector
    A MetadataPathSelector provides methods to retrieve or modify document structure nodes on a document structure node.
    Author:
    Matthias Ronge <matthias.ronge@zeutschel.de>

                     throws org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException

    • Method Detail

      • createIfPathExistsOnly

        protected void createIfPathExistsOnly(CopierData data,
                                      ugh.dl.DocStruct logicalNode,
                                      String value)
        Creates a metadatum with the given value if the full path is applied and no such metadatum is already available under at the path. Leaves the document structure element unchanged if such a metadatum already exists. This works recursively, by calling itself on the subnode, if found, or returning null otherwise. Metadata creation is, by definition, always done in a LocalMetadataSelector.
        Specified by:
        createIfPathExistsOnly in class MetadataSelector
        Parameters:
        data - data to work on
        logicalNode - document structure node to start from, intended for recursion
        value - value to write if no metadatum is available at the path’s end
        See Also:
        MetadataSelector.createIfPathExistsOnly(CopierData, DocStruct, String)

      • createOrOverwrite

        protected void createOrOverwrite(CopierData data,
                                 ugh.dl.DocStruct logicalNode,
                                 String value)
        Sets the metadatum identified by the given path if available, otherwise creates the path and metadatum. This works recursively. Metadata creation is done in a LocalMetadataSelector. If the DocStructType is set to "*", no path will be created if no path exists.
        Specified by:
        createOrOverwrite in class MetadataSelector
        Parameters:
        data - data to work on
        logicalNode - document structure node to start from, intended for recursion
        value - value to write
        See Also:
        MetadataSelector.createOrOverwrite(CopierData, DocStruct, String)

      • findAll

        protected Iterable<MetadataSelector> findAll(ugh.dl.DocStruct logicalNode)
        The function findAll() returns all concrete metadata selectors the potentially generic metadata selector expression resolves to.
        Specified by:
        findAll in class MetadataSelector
        Parameters:
        logicalNode - Node of the logical document structure to work on
        Returns:
        all metadata selectors the expression resolves to
        See Also:
        MetadataSelector.findAll(ugh.dl.DocStruct)

      • findIn

        protected String findIn(ugh.dl.DocStruct supernode)
        Returns the value of the metadatum named by the path used to construct the metadata selector, or null if either the path or the metadatum at the end of the path aren’t available. This works recursively, by calling itself on the subnode, if found, or returning null otherwise.
        Specified by:
        findIn in class MetadataSelector
        Parameters:
        supernode - document structure node to examine, intended for recursion
        Returns:
        the value the path points to, or null if absent
        See Also:
        MetadataSelector.findIn(ugh.dl.DocStruct)

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex()
        Returns the numeric index of the metadata selector, if any. If no index is specified (null), or generically refers to all or the last element, -1 is returned.
        Returns:
        the index number of the metadata selector

        public MetadataSelector getSelector()
